page.title: 18ALMONDBANK
page.content: South of the village of Almondbank which is situated to the north and outwith our area, lies the only substantial built-up area in our survey location. This area can be split up into two distinct parts. Firstly, lying just north of the A85 and south of Almondbank village, is the Royal Navy Workshops. This is a fairly large complex of factory workshops which in the past serviced aircraft of the Fleet Air Arm. To the north west of this instillation lies the derelict remains of an industrial complex once busily producing textiles for an ever eagar market. Now, only the shell of this once large, work intensive industry remains. The buildings stand as a memorial to the time when this was an important centre in the dying, weaving and manufacture of linen.
